info.description: Fitbit provides a Web API for accessing data from Fitbit activity trackers, Aria scale, and manually entered logs. Anyone can develop an application to access and modify a Fitbit user's data on their behalf, so long as it complies with Fitbit Platform Terms of Service. These Swagger UI docs do not currently support making Fitbit API requests directly. In order to make a request, construct a request for the appropriate endpoint using this documentation, and then add an Authorization header to each request with an access token obtained using the steps outlined here: https://dev.fitbit.com/build/reference/web-api/developer-guide/authorization/.
info.title: Fitbit Web API Explorer

get.description: Returns the intraday time series for a given resource in the format requested. If your application has the appropriate access, your calls to a time series endpoint for a specific day (by using start and end dates on the same day or a period of 1d), the response will include extended intraday values with a one-minute detail level for that day. Unlike other time series calls that allow fetching data of other users, intraday data is available only for and to the authorized user.

The endpoint returns weight and distance badges based on the user's unit profile preference as on the website.

Each subscriber can have only one subscription for a specific user's collection.

200.description: Returned if the given user is already subscribed to the stream.

201.description: Returned if a new subscription was created in response to your request.

409.description: Returned if the given user is already subscribed to this stream using a different subscription ID, OR if the given subscription ID is already used to identify a subscription to a different stream.

get.description: Retreives a list of a user's subscriptions for your application in the format requested. You can either fetch subscriptions for a specific collection or the entire list of subscriptions for the user. For best practice, make sure that your application maintains this list on your side and use this endpoint only to periodically ensure data consistency.

parameters.description: This is the resource of the collection to receive notifications from (foods, activities, sleep, or body). If not present, subscription will be created for all collections. If you have both all and specific collection subscriptions, you will get duplicate notifications on that collections' updates. Each subscriber can have only one subscription for a specific user's collection.
parameters.name: collection-path

parameters.description: This is the resource of the collection to receive notifications from (foods, activities, sleep, or body). If not present, subscription will be created for all collections. If you have both all and specific collection subscriptions, you will get duplicate notifications on that collections' updates. Each subscriber can have only one subscription for a specific user's collection.
parameters.name: subscription-id

204.description: No Content.  The request was successful.

400.description: Bad Request.  The request likely contained bad syntax.

401.description: Unauthorized.  The request requires user authentication.

delete.description: Deletes a subscription for a user..

parameters.description: This is the resource of the collection to receive notifications from (foods, activities, sleep, or body). If not present, subscription will be created for all collections. If you have both all and specific collection subscriptions, you will get duplicate notifications on that collections' updates. Each subscriber can have only one subscription for a specific user's collection.
parameters.name: collection-path

parameters.description: This is the unique ID of the subscription created by the API client application. Each ID must be unique across the entire set of subscribers and collections. The Fitbit servers will pass this ID back along with any notifications about the user indicated by the user parameter in the URL path.
parameters.name: subscription-id

200.description: Returned if the given user is already subscribed to the stream.

201.description: Returned if a new subscription was created in response to your request.

409.description: Returned if the given user is already subscribed to this stream using a different subscription ID, OR if the given subscription ID is already used to identify a subscription to a different stream.

post.description: Adds a subscription in your application so that users can get notifications and return a response in the format requested. The subscription-id value provides a way to associate an update with a particular user stream in your application.

400.description: The request had bad syntax or was inherently impossible to be satisfied.

post.description: Revokes consent of the access token or refresh token

token.description: The access token or refresh token to be revoked

post.summary: Revokes consent of the access token or refresh token

parameters.description: The Authorization header must be set to 'Basic' followed by a space, then the Base64 encoded string of your application's client id and secret concatenated with a colon. For example, 'Basic Y2xpZW50X2lkOmNsaWVudCBzZWNyZXQ='. The Base64 encoded string, 'Y2xpZW50X2lkOmNsaWVudCBzZWNyZXQ=', is decoded as 'client_id:client secret'.
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: Authorization code received in the redirect as URI parameter. Required if using the Authorization Code flow.
parameters.name: code

parameters.description: This is your Fitbit API application id from your settings on dev.fitbit.com.
parameters.name: client_id

parameters.description: Specify the desired access token lifetime. Defaults to 28800 for 8 hours. The other valid value is 3600 for 1 hour.
parameters.name: expires_in

parameters.description: Authorization grant type. Valid values are 'authorization_code' and 'refresh_token'.
parameters.name: grant_type

parameters.description: Uri to which the access token will be sent if the request is successful. Required if specified in the redirect to the authorization page. Must be exact match.
parameters.name: redirect_uri

parameters.description: Refresh token issued by Fitbit. Required if 'grant_type' is 'refresh_token'.
parameters.name: refresh_token

parameters.description: Required if specified in the redirect uri of the authorization page. Must be an exact match.
parameters.name: state

400.description: The request had bad syntax or was inherently impossible to be satisfied.

401.description: Authentication was unsuccessful due to invalid client credentials.

409.description: Request conflict due to multiple clients attempting to refresh the same access token.

post.description: Retrieves an OAuth 2 access token.

201.description: Returned if a new subscription was created in response to your request.

409.description: Returned if the given user is already subscribed to this stream using a different subscription ID, OR if the given subscription ID is already used to identify a subscription to a different stream.

post.description: Updates a user's profile using a form.

scopes.activity: Activity data and exercise log related features, such as steps, distance, calories burned, and active minutes
scopes.cardio_fitness: Maximum or optimum rate at which the users heart, lungs, and muscles can effectively use oxygen during exercise
scopes.heartrate: Continuous heart rate & HRV data and related analysis
scopes.irregular_rhythm_notifications: Includes the users engagement and list of irregular rhythm notification alerts.
scopes.nutrition: Calorie consumption and nutrition related features, such as food/water logging, goals, and plans
scopes.oxygen_saturation: SpO2 (Oxygen Saturation) is a measurement of your blood oxygen level
scopes.respiratory_rate: Respiratory Rate is a measurement of your breaths at night.
scopes.settings: User account and device settings, such as alarms
scopes.sleep: Sleep logs and related sleep analysis
scopes.social: Friend-related features, such as friend list and leaderboard
scopes.weight: Weight and related information, such as body mass index, body fat percentage, and goals

tags.description: The Active Zone Minutes (AZM) Intraday Time Series endpoints retrieve the user's heart-pumping activity for a specific date or 24 hour period. Intraday support can extend the detail-level response to include 1min, 5min and 15min for Active Zone Minutes.
tags.name: Active Zone Minutes Intraday Time Series

tags.description: The Active Zone Minutes (AZM) Time Series endpoints are used for querying the user's heart-pumping activity throughout the day.
tags.name: Active Zone Minutes Time Series

tags.description: The Activity endpoints are used to query and/or modify a Fitbit user's daily activity data.
tags.name: Activity

tags.description: The Activity Intraday Time Series endpoints retrieve the data for a given resource on a specific date or 24 hour period.  Intraday support can extend the detail-level response to include 1min, 5min and 15min for the activity.
tags.name: Activity Intraday Time Series

tags.description: The Activity Time Series endpoints are used to query a Fitbit user's activity data over a period of time, either by specifying a date and time period, or a date range.
tags.name: Activity Time Series

tags.description: The Authorization endpoints allow an application to onboard Fitbit users who want to share their data with the specified application. The application can initiate the consent flow for new users, obtain the access token and refresh tokens, validate the tokens, and revoke consent to the user.
tags.name: Authorization

tags.description: The Body endpoints are used for querying and modifying the user's body fat and weight data.
tags.name: Body

tags.description: The Body Time Series endpoints are used for querying body fat and weight data over a period of time either by specifying a date and time period, or a date range.
tags.name: Body Time Series

tags.description: Breathing Rate or Respiratory Rate is a measurement of your average breaths per minute at night.
tags.name: Breathing Rate

tags.description: The Breathing Rate Intraday endpoint returns the  average breathing rate throughout the day and categories your breathing rate by sleep stage.
tags.name: Breathing Rate Intraday

tags.description: The Cardio Fitness Score (also known as VO2 Max) endpoints are used for querying the maximum or optimum rate at which the users heart, lungs, and muscles can effectively use oxygen during exercise.
tags.name: Cardio Fitness Score (VO2 Max)

tags.description: The Devices endpoints displays information about the devices paired to a user's account.
tags.name: Devices

tags.description: The Electrocardiogram (also known as ECG) endpoint is used for querying the user's on-device ECG readings.
tags.name: Electrocardiogram

tags.description: The Friends endpoints display information about the specified user's friends and the friend's leaderboard.
tags.name: Friends

tags.description: The Heart Rate Intraday Time Series retrieves the heart rate data on a specific date or 24 hour period. Intraday support can extend the detail-level response to include 1sec, 1min, 5min or 15min for Heart Rate.
tags.name: Heart Rate Intraday Time Series

tags.description: The Heart Rate Time Series endpoints are used for querying the user's heart rate data.
tags.name: Heart Rate Time Series

tags.description: The Heart Rate Variability (HRV) endpoints are used for querying the users heart rate variability data.
tags.name: Heart Rate Variability

tags.description: The Heart Rate Variability Intraday endpoint returns the HRV rate at various times and returns Root Mean Square of Successive Differences (rmssd), Low Frequency (LF), High Frequency (HF), and Coverage data for a given measurement.
tags.name: Heart Rate Variability Intraday

tags.description: The Irregular Rhythm Notifications (also known as IRN) endpoints are used for querying the user's engagement with the IRN feature and the alerts received. The IRN API is for research use or investigational use only, and is not intended for clinical or diagnostic purposes.
tags.name: Irregular Rhythm Notifications

tags.description: The Nutrition endpoints are used for querying and modifying the food and water data.
tags.name: Nutrition

tags.description: The Nutrition Time Series endpoints are used for querying food- and water-related data over a period of time either by specifying a date and time period, or a date range.
tags.name: Nutrition Time Series

tags.description: The Sleep endpoints are used for querying and modifying the users general sleep data.
tags.name: Sleep

tags.description: SpO2 (Oxygen Saturation) is a measurement of your blood oxygen level.
tags.name: SpO2

tags.description: The SpO2 Intraday endpoints return the SpO2 values calculated on a 5-minute exponentially-moving average.
tags.name: SpO2 Intraday

tags.description: The Subscription endpoints allow an application to request notifications to user's specific data collection.
tags.name: Subscriptions

tags.description: The Temperature endpoints are used for querying either the core temperature data logged manually by the user, or the skin temperature recorded by the device while the user is asleep.
tags.name: Temperature

tags.description: The User endpoints display information about the user's profile information, the regional locale & language settings, and their badges collected
tags.name: User
